cluster_classes.class_description: Corrosion mechanisms affecting external surfaces, including underground or submerged systems and beneath insulation.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Corrosion on external surfaces and beneath insulation.

members.entity_description: Corrosion occurring on the outer surfaces of underground or submerged metallic piping systems.
Corrosion that occurs beneath insulation materials, often exacerbated by trapped moisture.

cluster_classes.class_description: Corrosion mechanisms occurring at elevated temperatures, including oxidation and sulfidation.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Corrosion at high temperatures, affecting material integrity.

members.entity_description: A chemical reaction that stainless steels resist due to their alloy content.
A chemical reaction that stainless steels resist due to their alloy content.
Corrosion occurring at elevated temperatures, affecting material integrity.

cluster_classes.class_description: The Heat Affected Zone (HAZ) is the area of base metal near a weld that has not melted but has undergone changes in microstructure and mechanical properties due to welding heat.

members.entity_description: The portion of the base metal adjacent to a weld with altered microstructure and properties due to welding heat.

args.new_description: Corrosion mechanisms affecting external surfaces, including corrosion under insulation and on underground or submerged systems.
args.justification: Class label and description updated for clarity and to better reflect the inclusion of corrosion under insulation; assigned to new Class_Group 'Corrosion Mechanisms' to connect with other corrosion-related classes.

args.new_description: Corrosion mechanisms occurring at elevated temperatures, including oxidation and sulfidation, affecting material integrity.
args.justification: Class label and description updated for clarity and to standardize naming; assigned to new Class_Group 'Corrosion Mechanisms' to connect with other corrosion-related classes.

args.new_description: The Heat Affected Zone (HAZ) is the area of base metal near a weld that has not melted but has undergone changes in microstructure and mechanical properties due to welding heat.
args.justification: Assigned to new Class_Group 'Welded Component Features' as it is a metallurgical region, not a corrosion mechanism; clarifies schema separation.

executed_decisions.new_description: Corrosion mechanisms affecting external surfaces, including corrosion under insulation and on underground or submerged systems.
executed_decisions.justification: Class label and description updated for clarity and to better reflect the inclusion of corrosion under insulation; assigned to new Class_Group 'Corrosion Mechanisms' to connect with other corrosion-related classes.

executed_decisions.justification: Class label and description updated for clarity and to standardize naming; assigned to new Class_Group 'Corrosion Mechanisms' to connect with other corrosion-related classes.

executed_decisions.justification: Assigned to new Class_Group 'Welded Component Features' as it is a metallurgical region, not a corrosion mechanism; clarifies schema separation.
